com.st.st25sdk.command

Interface VicinityMemoryCommandInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VicinityMemoryCommand

    public interface VicinityMemoryCommandInterface

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, int sizeInBlocks)
      Read function with Block granularity If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, the Block Security Status byte array of ReadBlockResult is filled with the blockSecurityStatus byte value for each requested block: blockSecurityStatus = 0 for unlocked block blockSecurityStatus = 1 for awrite-locked block (read only) blockSecurityStatus = FF if not read
      ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, int sizeInBlocks, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Read function with Block granularity If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, the Block Security Status byte array of ReadBlockResult is filled with the blockSecurityStatus byte value for each requested block: blockSecurityStatus = 0 for unlocked block blockSecurityStatus = 1 for awrite-locked block (read only) blockSecurityStatus = FF if not read
      byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress, int sizeInBytes)
      Read function with Byte granularity.
      byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress, int sizeInBytes, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Read function with Byte granularity.
      void writeBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, byte[] data)
      Write function with Block granularity
      void writeBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, byte[] data, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Write function with Block granularity
      void writeBytes(int byteAddress, byte[] data)
      Write function with Byte granularity
      void writeBytes(int byteAddress, byte[] data, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Write function with Byte granularity

      • readBlocks

        ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress,
                           int sizeInBlocks)
                    throws STException
        Read function with Block granularity If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, the Block Security Status byte array of ReadBlockResult is filled with the blockSecurityStatus byte value for each requested block: blockSecurityStatus = 0 for unlocked block blockSecurityStatus = 1 for awrite-locked block (read only) blockSecurityStatus = FF if not read
        Parameters:
        firstBlockAddress -
        sizeInBlocks -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        STException

        Parameters:

        sizeInBlocks -
        flag -

      • readBytes

        byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress,
                 int sizeInBytes,
                 byte flag,
                 byte[] uid)
          throws STException
        Read function with Byte granularity. If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, readBytes() will ignore it. To read the BSS byte, use readBlocks() instead.
        Parameters:
        byteAddress -
        sizeInBytes -
        flag -
        uid -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        STException
